Html:
(why sometimes editing toolbar doesn't appear???)
Hi Radioman.
I'd really like to set orientation of the image of a marker someway.
I defined my other marker, and could pass some other value to the creation instance (i can get gps ground track).
But your marker definition is quite complicated and i can't understand where would i go to rotate the image.

I tried something like
[code]
public class MyCustomMarker
  inherits GMapMarker
  private bearing as single
    public overrides sub new()
    ...
    end sub
end class
[/code]

but the internal GMapMarker variables are hidden even if i inherit.
So how should i do it?
check what Bearing property does, and create your own marker

It seems that the bearing property is defined only for the windowsform marker. I'm using WPF. There you implement it in your CircleVisual class.
But i do not understand it :(

Man it's 10 years i've been programming, just not in this ambient.
Having God before yourself doesn't necessarily mean you're going to understand him ;)

the only 'God' you'll find is in your self ;}

 ..anyway if you have a few markers you can simply use RenderTransform property on your visual, but if you gave hundreds of markers it will be slow, and thats why i've 'invented' CircleVisual ;}
in wpf each visual/marker has ZIndex property
Yeah i know, it was just for ordering purpose. Thanks
